intro: Pseudolmedia rigida subsp. rigida, commonly known as the rigid pseudolmedia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and rigid, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
